definition: Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties/generic term for historic period 220-589 between Han and Sui
the Song dynasty (960-1279)/refers to the Northern (960-1127) and Southern Song (1128-1279)
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
Yu Xin (513-581), poet from Liang of the Southern dynasties 南朝梁朝 and author of Lament for the South 哀江南賦|哀江南赋
